com.dropbox.sync.android

Class DbxFile

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.dropbox.sync.android.DbxFile

  • public class DbxFile
extends java.lang.Object
    A handle to a specific version of a particular file in Dropbox. It has basic file operations such as reading and writing the file's contents and getting info about the file. It can also tell you the current sync status, whether there's a newer version available, and allows you to update to the newer version.

    Use addListener(com.dropbox.sync.android.DbxFile.Listener), getNewerStatus(), and update() to update this handle to a newer version when updates are available. If you don't, you can continue to read a stale cached version indefinitely but writes will create a conflict.

    Note that open files will cause the Sync API to perform more frequent updates in the background to ensure new file versions are available. To avoid consuming extra power, you shouldn't keep files open when your app isn't in use.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  DbxFile.Listener
      A listener that will be called when there is a change to the sync status, metadata, or contents of this file.
      static class  DbxFile.StreamExclusionException
      An attempt was made to read or write this DbxFile when an existing read or write stream is already open.

    • Method Detail

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes this file, as well as any open read or write streams, and finalizes any outstanding writes to Dropbox. Must be called to release this file when finished with it.

        A failure finalizing writes will be logged as a warning but not re-thrown. Calling this method again on a closed file will have no effect but other methods on this object will throw IllegalStateException after calling this.

      • getPath

        public DbxPath getPath()
        Gets the path used to open or create this file.
        Returns:
        the path used to open or create this file.

      • getReadStream

        public java.io.FileInputStream getReadStream()
                                      throws DbxException,
                                             java.io.IOException
        Gets a stream that can be used to read data from this file. This method will block until the file has been downloaded into the cache before returning.

        Once a read stream has been opened on this file, no writes can be made to this file until this stream is closed, or the file is closed. Multiple read streams can be open at once.

        Callers can use the file-descriptor backing this stream if they need direct access to the file. The file-descriptor represents a file in the cache, and shouldn't be written, but can be freely read until this stream is closed.

        Returns:
        a stream that can be used to read data from this file.
        Throws:
        DbxException - if there is a failure in Dropbox.
        java.io.IOException - if there is a local I/O failure.
        DbxFile.StreamExclusionException - if there is already a write stream open.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this file is already closed.

      • readString

        public java.lang.String readString()
                            throws java.io.IOException
        Reads the full contents of this file as a String in UTF-8 encoding. This method will block until the file has been downloaded into the cache before returning.
        Returns:
        The contents of the file as a string.
        Throws:
        DbxException - if there is a failure in Dropbox.
        java.io.IOException - if there is a local I/O failure.
        DbxFile.StreamExclusionException - if there is already a write stream open.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this file is already closed.

      • getWriteStream

        public java.io.FileOutputStream getWriteStream()
                                        throws java.io.IOException
        Gets a stream that can be used to write data to this file. The write won't be visible in Dropbox until the stream is closed, or the file is closed. No other reads or writes can be made to this file until this stream is closed, or the file is closed.

        Callers can use the file-descriptor backing this stream if they need direct access to the file. The file-descriptor represents a new empty file, which will become the new Dropbox version when this stream is closed.

        Returns:
        a stream that can be used to write data to this file.
        Throws:
        DbxException - if there is a failure in Dropbox.
        java.io.IOException - if there is a local I/O failure.
        DbxFile.StreamExclusionException - if there is already a read or write stream open.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this file is already closed.

      • writeFromExistingFile

        public void writeFromExistingFile(java.io.File file,
                         boolean shouldSteal)
                           throws java.io.IOException
        Replaces the contents of this file in Dropbox with the contents of a given file. Optionally, Dropbox can "steal" the given file, moving it into the private cache to avoid the need for copying data. If stealing is allowed, no future attempts should be made to access the file.
        Parameters:
        file - The file containing the new contents.
        shouldSteal - Whether Dropbox should steal the file, moving it into the private cache rather than copying its contents.
        Throws:
        DbxException - if there is a failure in Dropbox.
        java.io.IOException - if there is a local I/O failure.
        DbxFile.StreamExclusionException - if there is already a read or write stream open.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this file is already closed.

      • writeString

        public void writeString(java.lang.String data)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Replaces the contents of this file in Dropbox with the given string, encoded in UTF-8. Sync API will attempt to sync the new contents of the file passed to this method as soon as this method completes.
        Parameters:
        data - The String to write into the file.
        Throws:
        DbxException - if there is a failure in Dropbox.
        java.io.IOException - if there is a local I/O failure.
        DbxFile.StreamExclusionException - if there is already a read or write stream open.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this file is already closed.

      • getInfo

        public DbxFileInfo getInfo()
                    throws DbxException
        Gets metadata about this file in Dropbox.
        Returns:
        the metadata of this file.
        Throws:
        DbxException - if there is a failure getting metadata.

      • update

        public boolean update()
               throws DbxException
        Updates this DbxFile to a newer cached version of the same file, as reflected by getNewerStatus(). This method will have no effect if there is no newer version, or the newer version isn't yet cached. This operation is equivalent to closing the file and reopening it, except that it will properly follow the file across rename and move operations.
        Returns:
        whether the file was updated to a new version.
        Throws:
        DbxException - if there is a failure updating.
        DbxFile.StreamExclusionException - if there are any read or write streams open.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this file is already closed.

      • getSyncStatus

        public DbxFileStatus getSyncStatus()
                            throws DbxException
        Gets the current status of synchronizing this version of this file.
        Returns:
        the sync status.
        Throws:
        DbxException - if there is a failure getting status.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this file is already closed.

      • getNewerStatus

        public DbxFileStatus getNewerStatus()
                             throws DbxException
        Checks for newer versions of this file, and returns the synchronization status of a newer version, if any. This method will report on the newest known version that has at least begun downloading. The version indicated may still be downloading, as reflected in the returned status. Once it is finished downloading and in a cached state, you can switch to it with a call to update().

        A return value of null indicates that this file version is the newest known version.

        Returns:
        the sync status of a newer version, or null if this version is the latest.
        Throws:
        DbxException.NotFound - if the file has been deleted after the version that was opened.
        DbxException - if there is a failure getting status.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this file is already closed.

      • addListener

        public void addListener(DbxFile.Listener l)
        Adds a listener that will be called when there is a change to the sync status, metadata, or contents of this file other versions of the same file.

        Adding the same listener multiple times will have no additional effect. A single call to removeListener(com.dropbox.sync.android.DbxFile.Listener) will still remove it. This method will be ignored, and listeners won't be called if the file is closed or the file system has been shut down.

        Parameters:
        l - the listener to add.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the listener is null.

      • removeListener

        public void removeListener(DbxFile.Listener l)
        Removes a listener previously registered with addListener(com.dropbox.sync.android.DbxFile.Listener).
        Parameters:
        l - the listener to add.
        Throws:
        DbxException - if there is a failure unregistering the listener.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this file is already closed.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the listener is null.
